Shortcuts

CBD.naivelog module¶

Helper module to allow for simplified logging.

Warning

In the future, this module may be removed. Its logic will be separated into some tracers and a SysLog logger.

CBD.naivelog.DEBUG = 0¶

Level identifier.

CBD.naivelog.INFO = 1¶

Level identifier.

CBD.naivelog.WARNING = 2¶

Level identifier.

CBD.naivelog.ERROR = 3¶

Level identifier.

CBD.naivelog.FATAL = 4¶

Level identifier.

CBD.naivelog.strToLevel(elvl)[source]¶

Go from string identifier of a logging level to the level identifier.

Parameters:elvl (str) – Must be one of DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR or FATAL, case-sensitive.

See also

  • levelToStr()
  • levelToShortStr()
CBD.naivelog.levelToStr(lvl)[source]¶

Go from a level identifier to the corresponding string representation.

Parameters:lvl (int) – The level identifier.

See also

  • strToLevel()
  • levelToShortStr()
CBD.naivelog.levelToShortStr(lvl)[source]¶

Go from a level identifier to a short, representative string.

Parameters:lvl (int) – The level identifier.

See also

  • strToLevel()
  • levelToStr()
class CBD.naivelog.Logger(modulename, level, crashlevel)[source]¶

Bases: object

A simple logging class.

Parameters:
  • modulename (str) – The name of the module.
  • level (int) – Lowest level for the logger to output.
  • crashlevel (int) – Level at which the logger should terminate.
debug(mainstr, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Send DEBUG message. Wrapper around the log() function.

Parameters:
  • mainstr (str) – The main message information.
  • *args – List of arguments for formatting the mainstr.
  • **kwargs – List of keyword arguments for formatting the mainstr.

Send INFO message. Wrapper around the log() function.

Parameters:
  • mainstr (str) – The main message information.
  • *args – List of arguments for formatting the mainstr.
  • **kwargs – List of keyword arguments for formatting the mainstr.

  • *args – List of arguments for formatting the mainstr.
  • **kwargs – List of keyword arguments for formatting the mainstr.

Send FATAL message. Wrapper around the log() function.

  • mainstr (str) – The main message information.
  • *args – List of arguments for formatting the mainstr.
  • **kwargs – List of keyword arguments for formatting the mainstr.
log(level, mainstr, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Send a message.

Parameters:
  • level (int) – Level at which there must be logged.
  • mainstr (str) – The main message information.
  • *args – List of arguments for formatting the mainstr.
  • **kwargs – List of keyword arguments for formatting the mainstr.

See also

  • debug()
  • info()
  • warning()
  • error()
  • fatal()
setLevel(level)[source]¶

Sets the level to a new value.

Parameters:level (int) – The new level.
formatmsg(level, mainstr)[source]¶

Formats the message, used internally.

Parameters:
  • level (int) – The level of the message.
  • mainstr (str) – The main message to print.
CBD.naivelog.defaultLogLevel = 1¶

Default level at which logging is enabled.

CBD.naivelog.defaultCrashLevel = 4¶

Default level at which a termination must occur.

CBD.naivelog.getAbstractLogLevel(env, default)[source]¶

Obtains the log level from the environment variables.

Parameters:
  • env (str) – Variable name.
  • default (Any) – The default value if the variable does not exist.
CBD.naivelog.getLogLevel()[source]¶

Gets the logging level from the environment.

CBD.naivelog.getCrashLevel()[source]¶

Gets the crash level from the environment.

CBD.naivelog.getLogger(modulename)[source]¶

Gets the logger for a certain module.

Parameters:modulename (str) – The module’s name.
